keyTakeAways: Virginia Giuffre, a victim of Jeffrey Epstein’s sex trafficking ring, claims in her posthumous memoir that she was raped and brutally beaten by a 'well-known Prime Minister'—a reference widely interpreted as being Prince Andrew, the Duke of York.

In the US version of the memoir, Giuffre refers to the man as a 'well-known Prime Minister'; in the UK version, he is called a 'former minister,' indicating a possible translation or editorial difference.
Giuffre alleges that Prince Andrew raped her multiple times, including when she was 17, and that he allegedly laughed during the abuse and became aroused by her fear.
Prince Andrew reportedly paid millions to settle a civil case brought by Giuffre in 2022, which she claims was a failure to provide accountability or an apology.
Giuffre alleges that Prince Andrew’s team attempted to hire online trolls to discredit her during her legal proceedings, adding to accusations of a coordinated effort to suppress her claims.
Andrew reportedly maintained contact with Epstein after publicly claiming to have broken off their relationship, contradicting his 2019 BBC interview where he stated he had severed ties.

The memoir intensifies a transatlantic scandal involving powerful individuals linked to Epstein, drawing renewed attention to the royal family and political figures involved in sex trafficking networks.
The publication of the memoir comes at a time when Andrew has already stepped down from using the title 'Duke of York,' but will keep the title 'Prince' as the son of Queen Elizabeth II.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Virginia Giuffre, a victim of Jeffrey Epstein’s sex trafficking network, published her posthumous memoir 'Nobody’s Girl,' in which she claims to have been raped and brutally beaten by a 'well-known Prime Minister'—widely interpreted as Prince Andrew. The memoir details her allegations of being trafficked to Andrew, including claims of being choked, humiliated, and forced into sex at age 17. It further alleges that Andrew’s team attempted to hire online trolls to discredit her, and that he maintained contact with Epstein despite claiming to have severed ties. These claims, supported by newly released emails and public statements, have intensified scrutiny on Prince Andrew, who has already stepped down from the title 'Duke of York' but retained the title 'Prince.' The publication has reignited a transatlantic scandal, undermining the royal family's image and prompting investigations by the Metropolitan Police, while highlighting broader patterns of power, abuse, and cover-up involving wealthy and political figures.
title: Virginia Giuffre Raped by ‘Well-Known Prime Minister,’ US Version of Posthumous Memoir Claims
